abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile focuses on
            promoting youth empowerment and inclusion by expanding
            skills and opportunities for youth groups in Timor-Leste.
            Youth played a seminal role in the violence that erupted in
            2006 which saw hundreds of thousands people displaced,
            property worth thousands of dollars destroyed, hundreds
            injured, and dozens killed. In the absence of a concerted
            effort to provide opportunities for youth to engage
            meaningfully with communities and government in national
            recovery and development efforts, the risk of youth
            marginalization from development and civic life would
            persist. The Youth Development Project financed by World
            Bank supported the government’s efforts to address the
            social, economic and political factors that led to the
            social instability. The project operationalized the National
            Youth Policy, implemented by the secretariat of state for
            youth and sports to work with youth groups, organizations
            and youth centers, and support youth initiatives. Youth for
            Local Development was implemented by Ministry of State and
            Administration and Territorial Management facilitating the
            participation of rural youth in community development
            activities and local development processes and to distribute
            small grants to youth in rural areas.
